alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 10:44PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Rock Island, Whiteside, Carroll, south central Stephenson, southeastern Jackson and eastern Clinton Counties through 1115 PM CDT... At 1044 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fulton, or 7 miles northwest of Morrison, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Fairhaven around 1055 PM CDT. Chadwick and Coleta around 1100 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Milledgeville. This includes Interstate 88 between mile markers 21 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
